cyclone.name: DORIAN
cyclone.current_location: about 110 miles ENE of West Palm Beach, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: expected to creep northwest just off the Florida east-coast today, then turn north near Jacksonville late Wednesday and accelerate north-northeast toward the Georgia–South Carolina shoreline and the North Carolina Outer Banks
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near or over the North Carolina coast (Outer Banks area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: North of Ponte Vedra Beach FL to South Santee River SC
weather_observation.warning_coast: North of Ponte Vedra Beach FL to Altamaha Sound GA
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire southeast U.S. coastline from central Florida through the Carolinas
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39–73 mph) are likely; brief hurricane-force gusts are possible if the core passes close to shore Wednesday night.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Inundation of 4–7 ft above ground possible along the northeast Florida coast and St. Johns River mouth during high tide.
weather_observation.rainfall: 3–6 inches with isolated amounts near 9 inches could produce urban and riverine flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents, minor coastal erosion, and a low risk of isolated tornadoes in outer rainbands.
